original: 24.21. Saraṇaduka, Mahantaradukādi🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nasārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ naanārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.

translated: The section on the pairs beginning with the non-root and the great root

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nacetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naaraṇaṁ nacetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saraṇo cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na saraṇam na cetasikam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na araṇam na cetasikam dhammam paṭicca saraṇaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a non-hostile, not-mentally-concomitant, phenomenon there arises a hostile, mentally-concomitant, phenomenon, a condition being through a root-cause condition.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nacittasampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo cittasampayutto dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate dve  na saraṇam na citta sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ citta sampayuttaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: (In brief.) In the case of the root-cause condition there are two, in the case of the condition being through presence there is one, in the case of the condition being through non-disappearance there are two.🔽Dependent on a non-hostile, not-associated-with-mind, phenomenon there arises a hostile, associated-with-mind, phenomenon, a condition being through a root-cause condition.

original: hetupaccayā. Naaraṇaṁ nacittasampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saraṇo cittasampayutto dhammo
analyzed: hetu paccayā na araṇam na citta sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca saraṇaḥ citta sampayuttaḥ dhammo
translated: Dependent on a non-hostile, not-associated-with-mind, phenomenon there arises a hostile, associated-with-mind, phenomenon, a condition being through a root-cause condition.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nacittasaṁsaṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo cittasaṁsaṭṭho dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na saraṇam na citta sasaṭṭham dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ citta sasaṭṭhaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: (In brief.) In the case of the root-cause condition there are two, in the case of the condition being through non-disappearance there are two.🔽Dependent on a non-hostile, not-conjoined-with-mind, phenomenon there arises a hostile, conjoined-with-mind, phenomenon, a condition being through a root-cause condition.

original: hetupaccayā. Naaraṇaṁ nacittasaṁsaṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saraṇo cittasaṁsaṭṭho dhammo
analyzed: hetu paccayā na araṇam na citta sasaṭṭham dhammam paṭicca saraṇaḥ citta sasaṭṭhaḥ dhammo
translated: Dependent on a non-hostile, not-conjoined-with-mind, phenomenon there arises a hostile, conjoined-with-mind, phenomenon, a condition being through a root-cause condition.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: (In brief.) In the case of the root-cause condition there are two, in the case of the condition being through non-disappearance there are two.
